snippet: The American Civil Liberties Union of Connecticut said a high school student in Wolcott was forced to remove a T-shirt that he had a right to wear.
abstract: American Civil Liberties Union claims that Connecticut's Wolcott High School violated student Seth Groody's right to free expression by asking him to remove a T-shirt with an antigay message; asks for assurances from school officials that students will be allowed to wear clothing with similar messages in the future.
lead_paragraph: The American Civil Liberties Union of Connecticut said a high school student in Wolcott was forced to remove a T-shirt that he had a right to wear.

headline.seo: A.C.L.U. Says Antigay-Shirt Ban at Connecticut School Was Illegal
